item.title: India vs Australia 5th Test Day 1 LIVE Score: Pant, Jadeja fall in quick succession as Boland, Starc strike; IND 9 down - Hindustan Times
item.description:
India vs Australia 5th Test Day 1 LIVE Score

Date: January 3, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

On Day 1 of the 5th Test, Rishabh Pant was pivotal for India before falling to Scott Boland after scoring 40 runs. Boland and Mitchell Starc troubled the Indian batting lineup, causing a series of dismissals.

  • Rishabh Pant scored 40 runs before being dismissed by Boland.
  • Indian team was 107/4 at tea, struggling against Australian bowlers.
  • Virat Kohli and KL Rahul fell early, pressuring the middle order.
  • Scott Boland took crucial wickets including Jadeja and Nitish Kumar Reddy.
“Pant's innings showed resilience but ended too soon, falling on a poor shot.”

The match intensity is escalating with Australia showing strong dominance, while India needs crucial partnerships to turn the tide.

item.title: India vs Australia LIVE, 5th Test, Day 1: Fresh DRS Controversy, Heartbroken Washington Sundar Departs - NDTV Sports
item.description:
India vs Australia Highlights, 5th Test, Day 1: Usman Khawaja Out On Last Ball Of Day 1 As Jasprit Bumrah Clashes With Sam Konstas

Date: January 3, 2025   Source: NDTV

On Day 1 of the 5th Test, India was bowled out for 185, while Australia ended the day at 9 for 1 after Khawaja fell to Bumrah on the last ball. Rishabh Pant top-scored for India with 40 runs in a challenging outing.

  • India scored 185 runs, recovering from a poor start at 57 for 3.
  • Rishabh Pant was the top scorer with 40 runs from 98 balls.
  • Scott Boland took 4 wickets for 31 runs for Australia.
  • Jasprit Bumrah struck with the final ball of the day, removing Usman Khawaja.
  • Captain Rohit Sharma rested himself, allowing Bumrah to lead during the toss.
“Bumrah gets the breakthrough with the last ball of Day 1.”

This gripping match sets the stage for an exciting continuation as both teams aim to capitalize on their strategies moving forward.

item.title: Ravi Shastri reveals why he couldn't ask Jasprit Bumrah about Rohit Sharma at the toss of Sydney Test - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Ravi Shastri Explains His Delay in Asking Bumrah About Rohit Sharma at Sydney Test Toss

Date: Jan 03, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

Former Indian cricket coach Ravi Shastri shared insights on why he didn't immediately inquire about Rohit Sharma's absence at the toss for the Sydney Test. This match was crucial as India was down 1-2 and needed a win to retain the trophy.

  • Jasprit Bumrah won the toss and chose to bat, revealing Rohit Sharma had opted out of the match.
  • Shastri didn't ask about Rohit's absence right at the toss, focusing instead on team composition.
  • Bumrah stated, "Our captain has shown his leadership; he's opted to rest in this game," affirming team unity.
  • Criticism arose from former batter Sanjay Manjrekar regarding Shastri's approach at the toss.
  • Shastri suggested that Rohit might consider retiring from Test cricket if his form does not improve.
"It's not that India don't have youngsters. There are very, very good players in the wings and it's time to build." - Ravi Shastri

In conclusion, the decision by Rohit Sharma to sit out was seen as a sign of strong leadership, but it also sparked discussions about his future in the format.

item.title: India vs Australia LIVE, 5th Test, Day 1: Rishabh Pant Struggling After Copping Body Blows; Aus Fear Penalty - NDTV Sports
item.description:
India vs Australia LIVE Score, 5th Test Day 1: Boland Nearly Claims Hat-trick as India's Batting Collapses

Date: January 3, 2025

Source: NDTV Sports Desk

Australia's Scott Boland took two wickets in as many balls, putting India under pressure on Day 1 of the 5th Test match in Sydney. Following the tea break, Rishabh Pant fell to a short ball, caught by Pat Cummins, and then Nitish Kumar Reddy was caught behind on the very next delivery as the Indian batting line-up struggled.

  • Boland claimed a total of four wickets in the innings.
  • India went from a solid position to 120/6 amid aggressive Australian bowling.
  • Pant and Jadeja attempted to stabilize the innings but faced a daunting challenge.
“Boland has been the standout bowler for Australia so far, claiming four wickets.”

This match is critical for the series, and India's performance will be under scrutiny as they aim to recover on Day 2.

item.title: India vs Australia LIVE, 5th Test, Day 1: Kohli's Offside Demons Haunt Again, Pant Hit On Helmet - NDTV Sports
item.description:
India vs Australia LIVE Score, 5th Test, Day 1: Rishabh Pant Takes Blows To Body, Steers India To 107/4 At Tea vs Aus

Date: January 3, 2025 Source: NDTV Sports

Amid criticism, Rishabh Pant coped several blows to his body, steering India to 107/4 at Tea on Day 1 of the 5th Test against Australia in Sydney. Pant was unbeaten on 32 off 80 balls while Jadeja was batting alongside him on 50.

  • India suffered a significant blow with Virat Kohli's dismissal, caught in the slips.
  • At Tea, India is at 107/4 with Rishabh Pant and Ravindra Jadeja at the crease.
  • Scott Boland has taken 2 wickets for Australia, emerging as the pick of the bowlers.
  • Rohit Sharma opted out of this Test, with Jasprit Bumrah as stand-in captain.
“It still is a brave call for a captain to own up and say, 'I'm prepared to take the bench in this game.'” – Ravi Shastri

India will need to build on the current partnership to recover from a shaky start.

item.title: 'Operation' Rohit Sharma: Why so 'secretive' about it? Asks Sanjay Manjrekar - The Times of India
item.description:
'Operation' Rohit Sharma: Why so 'secretive' about it? Asks Sanjay Manjrekar

Publication Date: Not specified, Source: Times of India

India's captain Rohit Sharma has been dropped from the playing eleven for the crucial Test against Australia, raising questions about the lack of clarity surrounding his exclusion.

  • Rohit scored only 31 runs in five innings during the Border Gavaskar Trophy.
  • Shubman Gill replaced Rohit while KL Rahul returned to the opener position.
  • Sanjay Manjrekar criticized the secrecy over Rohit's exclusion during the toss.
  • Bumrah indicated Rohit opted to rest, suggesting team unity.
  • Manjrekar expressed disbelief over Rohit's rest decision in such a critical match.
“We just don’t give them facts as much as they deserve by this very mysterious and secretive operation around some important matters.” - Sanjay Manjrekar

The indecision surrounding Rohit's situation has sparked debate among fans and commentators about transparency in Indian cricket.

item.title: Drama at SCG! Nervous Rohit Sharma jumps out of his seat for Virat Kohli’s golden duck call - The Times of India
item.description:
Drama at SCG! Nervous Rohit Sharma jumps out of his seat for Virat Kohli’s golden duck call

Publication Date: None available Source: Times of India

The SCG Test witnessed heightened tension when a controversial umpiring decision kept Virat Kohli in the game after he survived a golden duck on his first ball.

  • Kohli's near dismissal: Kohli faced a delivery from Scott Boland that seemed to edge through to slips.
  • Umpire's decision: TV umpire Joel Wilson ruled Kohli not out after reviewing footage.
  • Rohit's tension: Rohit Sharma, sitting out this match, displayed visible nerves as he watched Kohli's fate unfold.
  • Impact on the match: The incident added to the competitiveness of the Test match.
“Once the decision came through in Kohli’s favour, Rohit finally sat back, appearing more at ease.”

This moment of drama highlights the high stakes of Test cricket and the emotional investment of players, even those not on the field.

item.title: Chosen for Khel Ratna honour, Gukesh promises best moves in future as well - The Hindu
item.description:
Gukesh Vows to Deliver Best Moves After Winning Khel Ratna Award

Date: January 03, 2025 Source: The Hindu

Chess world champion D Gukesh has been awarded the prestigious 'Khel Ratna' honour and has promised to deliver his best moves both on and off the chessboard.

  • Gukesh is the youngest-ever world champion, having recently defeated Ding Liren.
  • This award recognizes his achievements alongside other athletes like Manu Bhaker, Harmanpreet Singh, and Praveen Kumar.
  • In a heartfelt message on social media, Gukesh thanked Prime Minister Modi for his support and promised to continue excelling in his sport.
“Honourable Prime Minister Shri @narendramodi ji, I am truly grateful and feel humbled to receive the prestigious Major Dhyan Chand Khel Ratna Award. Your words and guidance have always inspired me to strive for excellence and make the nation proud.” — Gukesh D

Gukesh aims to inspire others with his dedication to chess and his commitment to making India proud in international sports.

item.title: Steven Smith '100%' certain he got his hands under Virat Kohli's catch - ESPNcricinfo
item.description:
Steven Smith '100%' certain he got his hand under Virat Kohli's catch

Publication Date: [Insert Date Here] Source: ESPN Cricinfo

Steven Smith is unequivocal, claiming he was "100%" certain he caught Virat Kohli's edge during the SCG Test, despite the decision being ruled not out by the TV umpire.

  • Smith was confident in his claim, stating he got his hand underneath the ball.
  • The incident occurred during the eighth over of the match.
  • The on-field umpires referred the catch to TV umpire Joel Wilson, who judged the ball had touched the ground.
  • Former ICC umpire Simon Taufel expressed understanding of the TV umpire's decision.
  • At lunch, Kohli was unbeaten on 12 runs, with India struggling at 57 for 3.
"100%. No denying it whatsoever, 100%" - Steven Smith

This incident highlights the ongoing challenges and controversies surrounding decision-making in cricket, especially with the use of technology in officiating.

item.title: "Selfless and secure Rohit Sharma did which other captains wouldn't have done": Legendary all-rounder hails star batter for opting out of the fifth Test - Crictoday
item.description:
“Selfless and secure Rohit Sharma did which other captains wouldn’t have done”

Published on: December 2024 | Source: Crictoday

Rohit Sharma's decision to opt out of the fifth Test against Australia has sparked discussion among cricket fans. His choice to prioritize team performance over individual presence, especially given his recent struggles with form, highlights his leadership qualities.

  • Rohit Sharma was struggling with form, prompting Shubman Gill's return to the playing XI.
  • India currently trails 1-2 in the Test series after four matches.
  • Irfan Pathan praised Rohit for making a selfless decision that is rare among captains.
  • The Indian team maintains secrecy regarding internal decisions, adding to the intrigue of Rohit's choice.
“It is better to leave if your batter is not able to do the talking. Rohit Sharma thought about the team and added a better player, Shubman Gill, to the Playing XI.” - Irfan Pathan

This decision bolsters Rohit Sharma's reputation as a secure and considerate leader, paving the way for team success over individual accolades.

item.title: India vs Australia LIVE, 5th Test, Day 1: Australia's Spin Gamble Works, India Suffer Big Blow Before Lunch - NDTV Sports
item.description:
India vs Australia LIVE Score, 5th Test, Day 1: Kohli Commits Same Mistake Again, India Lose 4th Wicket

Date: Not specified, Source: NDTV Sports

As India faces Australia in the 5th Test, day one sees India lose its fourth wicket as Virat Kohli repeats a previous mistake.

  • India started the match strong but quickly lost key players.
  • Kohli’s performance has been scrutinized as he once again makes a critical mistake, contributing to India's struggles.
  • Fans and analysts remain hopeful for a turnaround as the match progresses.
"Kohli commits the same mistake again, leading to another early wicket for India."

This match is crucial for both teams as they aim for victory in the ongoing series. Fans are eager to see if India can recover from this setback.

item.title: "I thought that was out": Michael Vaughan refuses to accept third umpire's decision on Virat Kohli - Crictoday
item.description:
Michael Vaughan Questions Third Umpire's Decision on Kohli's Catch

Publication Date: January 3, 2025

Source: Crictoday

Former England cricket captain Michael Vaughan has openly contested the third umpire's decision, which ruled that Virat Kohli had not been caught out during a recent match, igniting debates among cricket fans.

  • Michael Vaughan disagrees with the third umpire’s call regarding Kohli’s catch.
  • The incident occurred when Steve Smith appeared to take a catch off Kohli but was ruled not out after video replays.
  • Vaughan mentioned, “I thought that was OUT,” expressing frustration with the decision.
  • Recent changes in the Indian team include Shubman Gill replacing Rohit Sharma as Test captain.
“I thought that was OUT . . .” — Michael Vaughan (@MichaelVaughan) January 3, 2025

This incident has sparked considerable attention and debate within the cricket community regarding the accuracy and consistency of third umpire decisions.

item.title: 'Rohit Sharma's absence mysterious and secretive operation, fans won't accept him resting': Bumrah, Gambhir questioned - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Rohit Sharma's Mysterious Absence raises Questions among Fans and Experts

Date: Jan 03, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

Former India cricketer Sanjay Manjrekar has criticized the non-questioning of Jasprit Bumrah concerning Rohit Sharma's absence from the Sydney Test, which he termed as 'mysterious and secretive'. Manjrekar and others believe that fans deserve clarity on such matters.

  • Rohit Sharma opted to rest for the final Test of the Border-Gavaskar Trophy.
  • Jasprit Bumrah led the team in Rohit's absence, but was not asked about it during the toss.
  • Manjrekar questioned the lack of transparency around Rohit's status and criticized the decision to rest him over Bumrah.
  • He stated that Rohit should not be considered an all-time great like Virat Kohli.
  • Rohit scored only 31 runs in five innings across three Tests, raising questions about his future in Test cricket.
“When they see Bumrah walking out, the first thought in their minds is what happened to Rohit Sharma?” - Sanjay Manjrekar

The incident has ignited discussions around the culture of openness in Indian cricket and the importance of fans' right to know about player decisions.

item.title: India vs Australia LIVE, 5th Test, Day 1: KL Rahul Disappoints As Mitchell Starc Draws 1st Blood - NDTV Sports
item.description:
India vs Australia LIVE Score, 5th Test, Day 1: Kohli-Gill Fight Back After India Suffered Twin Blows Early

Date & Source: Not provided

In the first day of the 5th Test match between India and Australia, India faced early setbacks but Kohli and Gill initiated a fight back.

  • India suffered two early wickets.
  • Kohli and Gill showed resilience to stabilize the innings.
  • Live scores and updates are available online.
“It’s crucial for us to build a good partnership after early wickets,” said a spokesperson.

This match highlights the challenges and competitive spirit in international cricket as two top teams face off.

item.title: Offspin to pace, and a mountain of runs: Webster's rise to Test cricket - ESPNcricinfo
item.description:
Offspin to pace, and a mountain of runs: Webster's rise to Test cricket

Publication Date: January 2024 | Source: ESPN Cricinfo

Australia handed a debut to Tasmania allrounder Beau Webster for the final Test against India at the SCG, highlighting a decade-long journey to the national side.

  • Webster was born in Snug, Tasmania, and made his first-class debut in February 2014.
  • He showcased his potential with back-to-back centuries in the Sheffield Shield.
  • A significant change came during the Covid lockdown when he revived his pace bowling.
  • Webster concluded the 2023-24 Sheffield Shield season with remarkable stats: 938 runs at an average of 58.62 and 30 wickets.
  • He secured his spot in the national radar with impressive performances for Australia A and in county cricket with Gloucestershire.
"I don't think I'd be standing here if I was still wheeling out the offspinners." - Beau Webster

Webster's persistence and adaptability have finally led him to a place in Test cricket, marking an important milestone in his cricketing career.

item.title: Sunil Gavaskar interview: ‘Indian cricket–the umbilical cord I can’t snap,’ he says on the unshakeable tie that defines his life - The Indian Express
item.description:
Sunil Gavaskar interview: ‘Indian cricket–the umbilical cord I can’t snap,’ he says on the unshakeable tie that defines his life

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: The Indian Express

In a heartfelt interview, Sunil Gavaskar reflects on his enduring relationship with Indian cricket, highlighting memorable moments and his emotional investment in the game.

  • Gavaskar shares anecdotes from his career and personal interactions with fellow cricketers, emphasizing the bonds formed over decades.
  • He expresses pride in defending Indian cricket and critiques foreign perceptions of India's dominance.
  • Gavaskar remarks on his deep emotional ties to the sport, stating that Indian cricket is an unbreakable connection in his life.
“Indian cricket is the umbilical cord that I can’t snap.” - Sunil Gavaskar

Looking back on his journey, Gavaskar affirms his passion for the game and his commitment to commentating on Indian cricket, despite his long career in the field.

item.description: No summary available for this article. Click the link to read more.

item.title: 'Team Management Didn't Consistently Select Ashwin... Deserved A Grand Farewell': Anil Kumble Lambasts Indi - News18
item.description:
Anil Kumble Critiques Indian Team for Mishandling Ashwin's Career

Date: January 02, 2025 Source: News18

Anil Kumble expressed his disappointment regarding how the Indian cricket team managed Ravichandran Ashwin's career, insisting he deserved a grand farewell as a matchwinner.

  • Kumble criticized the Indian team's management for not utilizing Ashwin properly as a versatile player.
  • Ashwin retired after the BGT, where he should have received a grand farewell.
  • Kumble emphasized that many previous cricketers also lacked proper farewells after long contributions.
  • Ashwin's record boasts an average of 24 in 106 Test matches, placing him seventh among all-time wicket-takers.
“Players who have contributed for such a long period deserve a grand farewell.” - Anil Kumble

Kumble's remarks highlight the need for better planning in handling retiring players who have made significant contributions to their teams.

item.title: 4 Gujarat Titans cricketers under scanner in Rs 450-crore chit fund scam: Sources - India Today
item.description:
Gujarat Titans Cricketers Linked to Rs 450-Crore Ponzi Scheme

Published On: Jan 2, 2025 | Source: India Today

Four players from the Gujarat Titans cricket team are being investigated in connection with a Rs 450-crore Ponzi scheme. The scheme, run by Bhupendrasinh Zala, has raised questions about players' involvement and potential financial losses.

  • Four Gujarat Titans cricketers are linked to BZ Group's Ponzi scheme.
  • The scheme has reportedly defrauded over 11,000 investors.
  • Zala promised annual returns of 36% but has now defaulted.
  • The investigation is ongoing, with the CID working to recover funds.
"Zala reportedly confessed during interrogation that he had failed to return the investments made by the cricketers involved."

As the investigation unfolds, more details about the players’ involvement and the ramifications for the team are anticipated.

item.title: ISL: Bikash Yumnam signs pre-contract agreement with Kerala Blasters FC - Khel Now
item.description:
Bikash Yumnam Signs Pre-Contract with Kerala Blasters FC

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Khel Now

Bikash Yumnam, a 21-year-old defender from Chennaiyin FC, has signed a pre-contract agreement with Kerala Blasters FC as his current contract ends at the 2024-25 ISL season.

  • Yumnam can now negotiate moves for next season.
  • He made 29 appearances with over 2,000 minutes played.
  • Average stats include 1.2 tackles per game and 19 clearances this season.
  • Has represented India at U-16 to U-23 levels.
  • Kerala Blasters aims to enhance their squad with this signing.
“Kerala Blasters acted quickly to wrap up this multi-year deal with Bikash Yumnam ahead of the 2025-26 season, warding off interest from other ISL sides,” said a source tracking the deal.

This signing is a strategic move to potentially field an all-Indian defense, allowing a more versatile use of foreign players in the squad.

item.title: Raza, Nyamhuri share spoils as Afghanistan all out for 157 - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Raza, Nyamhuri share spoils as Afghanistan all out for 157

Date: Jan 02, 2025
Source: Hindustan Times

Veteran Sikandar Raza and teenager Newman Nyamhuri took three wickets each as Zimbabwe bowled out Afghanistan for 157 on Thursday on the first day of the second Test in Bulawayo.

  • Zimbabwe started their innings with 6 runs at stumps.
  • Captain Craig Ervine won the toss and chose to bowl, capitalizing on favorable conditions.
  • Afghanistan's captain Hashmatullah Shahidi and Rahmat Shah had notable performances in the past, but couldn't replicate their success this time.
  • A 27-run last-wicket stand helped Afghanistan reach a total of 157.
“Given the conditions, I was convinced bowling first was the way to go. The wicket had been under covers for some time.” - Craig Ervine

This match showcases the promising talent of Zimbabwe's young players and highlights the challenges faced by the Afghan team in this Test series.

item.title: "Rohit Sharma Addressed The Media...": Sunil Gavaskar Gives Fresh Twist To 'Rift' Rumours - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Sunil Gavaskar Dismisses Rumors of Rifts in Indian Cricket Team

Publication Date: January 1, 2025

Source: NDTV

Following India's significant loss to Australia, speculations about conflicts within the team's dressing room have surfaced. Sunil Gavaskar, however, attributes these stories to media exaggeration and insists they only arise after team losses.

  • Reports of dressing room rifts emerged after India's defeat to Australia.
  • Sunil Gavaskar criticized the media for fueling these rumors.
  • Gavaskar stated that such speculation occurs frequently after Indian team losses.
  • Rohit Sharma may be rested for the upcoming fifth Test against Australia.
  • Gautam Gambhir clarified that these reports are not truthful.
"Every time the Indian team has not done well, these things about rifts come up. It's almost as if we people feel that the Indian team cannot lose." - Sunil Gavaskar

In conclusion, while media speculations create narratives of conflict, both Gavaskar and Gambhir emphasize the need to focus on team performance instead.
